info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:21PM PST until January 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Elevations above 5500 feet in the South Central Oregon Cascades and the Siskiyou Mountains. This includes Mt. Ashland, Crater Lake, Highway 62 and the Mt. Ashland Ski Road. * WHEN...From 10 PM to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult with longer travel times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will approach an inch an hour at times Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
